findings.title: C01. Incorrect Mathematical Operation
findings.description: Assuming decimals are 18 when doing mathematical operations on stable token amounts retrieved from the oracle may lead to incorrect results when swapping.

findings.title: I03. Tests Coverage
findings.description: It is important to write full coverage tests in order to catch possible logical issues.

findings.title: Flashloan Attack
findings.description: When working with exchange rates, they should be received from a trusted source and not be vulnerable to short-term rate changes that can be achieved by using flash loans. Oracles should be used.

findings.title: Token Supply Manipulation
findings.description: Contract owners or any other third party should not be able to access funds belonging to users and manipulate token supply.

findings.title: Gas Limit and Loops
findings.description: Transaction execution costs should not depend dramatically on the amount of data stored on the contract. There should not be any cases when execution fails due to the block Gas limit.

findings.title: Style Guide Violation
findings.description: Functions and state variables visibility should be set explicitly. Visibility levels should be specified consciously.

findings.title: Requirements Compliance
findings.description: The audit report does not explicitly state compliance with technical requirements.

findings.title: Environment Consistency
findings.description: Smart contract data should be consistent all over the data flow.

findings.title: Secure Oracles Usage
findings.description: The code should have the ability to pause specific data feeds that it relies on. This should be done to protect a contract from compromised oracles.
